title: Peter Andre puts Kate Garraway on the spot about I’m a Celebrity
text:
Kate is remaining coy about the I’m a Celeb line-up (Picture: ITV)

Peter Andre couldn’t help but challenge Kate Garraway on the rumours she’s signed up for I’m A Celebrity but it only made her more ‘flustered’.

The Good Morning Britain presenter is rumoured to have a confirmed spot on the line-up for this year’s series, but has refused to confirm or deny her place.

But of course, former I’m a Celeb star Peter just had to try and get to the bottom of the rumours and decided to put Kate on the spot during Tuesday’s episode of GMB.

Offering some advice for the potential jungle newbie, Peter said: ‘Listen, let me really talk you through if you decide to do it, or if you are already doing this.’

Appearing to be intrigued by what Peter has to say, the presenter replied: ‘What, you are offering me the inside track?’

But suspicious about her sudden interest, the popstar wondered: ‘Why are you asking so many questions?’

Kate then tried to backtrack and stated: ‘I don’t know, I’m a journalist, I’m paid to ask questions about all sorts of things. I’ve got a little flustered again,’ before her co-host Charlotte Hawkins changed the subject.

Later Kate added coyly: ‘I can neither confirm or deny, or deny or confirm.’

It comes after Kate refused to confirm her involvement with the next series, which is expected to air next month.

Speaking yesterday on GMB, she said: ‘Even if I was doing it, I won’t be able to say I’m doing it. And even if I wasn’t doing it, I can’t say I’m not doing it.’

She added: ‘It would be horrific. I don’t like heights, I don’t like the dark. I don’t like camping. ‘That is a good point actually, you can’t make a mess in the jungle because it’s already nature. I couldn’t be tidy in the jungle.

‘There’s nothing about the show I’d be good at.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays on ITV at 6am.
